chunks.original_text: 后来依旧去参人，勘破多少野狐精，个个不是真一处，都是旁门不是真。 恐君虚度此青春，从头一一为君陈，若非金液还丹诀，不必空自劳精神。 有如迷者学采战，心心只向房中恋，谓之阴丹御女方，手按眉间吸气咽， 夺人精气补吾身，执着三峰信邪见。 产门唤作生身处，九浅一深行几遍， 轩后彭祖老容成，黄谷寿光赵飞燕，他家别有通霄路，酒肆淫坊戏历炼。 莫言花裹遇神仙，即把金篦换瓦片，树根已朽叶徒青，气海波翻死如箭。 其他有若诸旁门，尚自可给安乐缘，有如服气为中黄，有如守顶为混元， 有如运气为先天，有如咽液为灵泉。 或者脾边认一穴，执定为之呼吸根， 或者口鼻为玄牝，纳清吐浊为返还，或者默朝高上帝，心目上视守泥丸。 与彼存思气升降，以此谓之夹脊关，与彼闭息吞津唾，谓之玉液金液丹， 与彼存神守脐下，与彼作念想眉问。 又如运心思脊骨，又如合口柱舌端， 炼肩缩颈偃脊背，唤作直入王京山。 口为华池舌为龙，唤作神水流潺潺， 此个旁门安乐法，拟作天仙岂不难？ 八十放九咽其一，聚气归脐谓胎息， 手持念珠数呼吸，水壶土圭则时刻。 或依灵宝秘法行，直勒尾间咽津液， 或参西山会真记，终日无言面对壁。 时人虽是学坐禅，何曾月照寒潭碧， 时人虽是学抱元，何曾如玉之在石。 或言大道本无为，枯木灰心孤默默， 或言已自显现成，试问幻身何处得。 更有劳形采日月，谓之天魂与地魄， 更有终宵服七曜，谓之造化真血脉，更有肘后飞金精，气自腾腾水滴滴， 更有太乙含真气，心自冥冥贤寂寂。 有般循环运流珠，有般静定想朱橘， 如斯皆是养命方，即非无质生灵质。 道要无中养就儿，个中别有真端的， 都绿简易妙天机，散在丹书不肯泄。 可伶愚夫自执迷，迷迷相指画无无， 个般诡怪颠狂辈，坐中摇动颤多时。 屈伸偃仰千万状，啼哭叫唤如儿嬉， 盖缘方寸无主人，气虚气散神狂飞，一队妄想争唱哄，以此诳俗诱愚痴， 不知与道合其真，与鬼合邪徒妄为。 一才心动气随动，跳跃颤掉运神机， 或曰此是阳气来，或日龙虎争战时，或曰河车千万迎，或日水火柑奔驰。 看看摇摆五脏气，一旦脑泻精神羸，当初神祖留丹诀，无中生有作丹基， 何曾有此鬼怪状，尽是下士徒阐提。 我闻前代诸圣师，无为之中无不为， 尽於无相生实相，不假想化并行持。 则有些儿奇又奇，心肾元来非坎高， 肝心脾肺肾肠胆，只是空屋旧藩篱，涕唾津精气血液，只可接助为阶梯， 精神魂魄心意气，观之自是而实非。 何须内观及鉴形，或听灵响视泓池， 吞霞饮露服元气，功效不验心神疲，演说清虚弄炉火，索人投状斋金宝， 敢将蛙草藐沧俱，元始天尊即是我，虚收衔号伪神通，指划鬼神说因果， 今朝明朝又奏名，内丹外丹无不可，欺贤罔圣昧三光，自视祸福皆嬷罗， 招邀徒弟走市尘，醉酒饱德成群伙。 大道从来绝名相，真仙本自无花草， 教他戒誓立辛勤，争如汝自辛勤好，一人迷昧犹自可，迷以传迷迷至老。 此辈一盲引众盲，共入迷途真忧恼，忽朝福尽罪报来，获罪於天无所祷， 三元九府录其愆，迫魄系魄受冥考。 举世人人喜学仙，几人日日去参玄， 各自妄诞自相高，不务真实为真诠。
chunks.translated_text:
Later, I still went forth to seek masters,
Examining how many wild fox spirits I exposed—
Each and every one not the true One,
All mere side doors, not the authentic Way.

I fear you waste this youthful spring in vain,
So I recount it all from the beginning for you:
Unless it be the secret of the golden liquor and returning elixir,
There is no need to squander your spirit in vain.

Like the deluded who study "bedchamber arts,"
Their hearts ever clinging to lustful union,
Calling it "yin elixir" or "the method of controlling women,"
Pressing fingers between the brows to swallow qi,
Seizing others’ essence to replenish their own,
Clinging to the Three Peaks with perverse views—
The birth gate they call the "source of life,"
Nine shallow thrusts and one deep, repeated endlessly.
Xuanyuan, Pengzu, Lao Rongcheng,
Huanggu, Shouguang, Zhao Feiyan—
Their households have other paths to the heavens,
Practiced in wine shops and brothels.
Do not say you meet immortals among the flowers,
Only to trade a golden hairpin for a clay tile.
The root is already rotten, leaves but green in vain,
The qi-sea churns, death comes swift as an arrow.

Other side doors may still offer some ease and comfort:
Some practice "serving qi" as the Central Yellow,
Some "guarding the crown" as the Primordial Chaos,
Some "circulating qi" as the Precelestial,
Some "swallowing saliva" as the Numinous Spring.
Or they fixate on a point beside the spleen,
Insisting it is the root of breath;
Or take mouth and nose as the Mysterious Female,
Inhaling purity and exhaling turbidity as "returning and restoring."
Or silently supplicate the Highest Lord,
Eyes upturned to guard the Mud Pill.
With these, they visualize qi’s ascent and descent,
Calling it the "Spine’s Pass";
Or hold breath and swallow saliva,
Calling it the "Jade Liquor and Golden Liquor Elixir";
Or concentrate spirit below the navel,
Or fix thoughts between the brows.
Some circulate the mind along the spine,
Some press the tongue to the palate,
Hunch shoulders, crane necks, arch backs—
Calling it "direct entry to the Royal Capital Mountain."
Mouth as the "Flowery Pond," tongue as the dragon,
Calling it "numinous water flowing murmuringly."
These side-door methods of ease and comfort,
How can they hope to become celestial immortals?

Eighty swallows, nine held back, one swallowed,
Gathering qi to the navel as "embryonic breathing,"
Hands clutching prayer beads to count breaths,
Water clocks and earthen gnomons to mark time.
Or following the *Lingbao* secret methods,
Forcibly restraining the tailbone to swallow saliva;
Or studying the *Xishan Huizhen Ji*,
Facing the wall in silence all day.
Though people now learn to sit in meditation,
When has the moon ever illumined the cold pond’s jade?
Though they practice "embracing the One,"
When have they ever been like jade hidden in stone?

Some say the Great Dao is fundamentally non-action,
Dry wood, dead ash, solitary silence;
Some claim it is already manifest and complete,
Yet ask them—where is the illusory body obtained?
Others exhaust their forms gathering sun and moon,
Calling it "heavenly hun and earthly po";
Others ingest the Seven Luminaries through the night,
Calling it the "true bloodline of creation";
Others "fly golden essence from behind the elbow,"
Qi steaming, water dripping;
Others "contain the true qi of Taiyi,"
Hearts darkly serene, worthy and still.
Some circulate the flowing pearl in cycles,
Some in stillness visualize red tangerines—
Such are all methods for nurturing life,
Yet none can transform insubstantial into numinous essence.

The Dao’s essentials nurture the child within the void,
Within it lies the true and certain mark.
All rely on the wondrous heavenly mechanism’s simplicity,
Scattered through alchemical texts yet never revealed.
Pitiful are the foolish who cling to delusion,
Pointing at one another, sketching emptiness upon emptiness.
Such bizarre and deranged lot,
Sitting and swaying, trembling for hours,
Bending, stretching, prostrating in countless postures,
Weeping and wailing like children at play—
All because the square inch of their hearts has no master,
Qi scattered, spirit wild and flying.
A throng of vain thoughts clamoring in chorus,
Deceiving the common folk, beguiling the foolish.
They know not how to unite with the Dao’s truth,
Only to unite with demons in vain folly.

Once the heart stirs, qi follows,
Leaping, trembling, activating the spirit’s mechanism.
Some say this is "yang qi arriving,"
Some say it is "dragon and tiger battling,"
Some say the "river chariot welcomes a thousand times,"
Some say "water and fire rush in pursuit."
Watch as they sway the qi of the five viscera,
One day the brain drains, the spirit withers.
The ancestral immortals left elixir secrets,
Generating something from nothing as the elixir’s foundation—
When was there ever such ghostly and monstrous behavior?
All are the delusions of inferior scholars.

I have heard the sages and masters of former ages:
Within non-action, nothing is not done,
All arises from formlessness to generate true form,
No need for visualization or forced cultivation.
Therein lies the marvel, strange and wondrous—
Heart and kidney were never Kan and Li,
Liver, heart, spleen, lungs, kidneys, intestines, gallbladder,
Only old fences around empty houses.
Tears, saliva, essence, qi, blood, fluids,
Only aids to be used as stepping stones.
Spirit, hun, po, heart, intent, qi—
Observe them: they seem real, yet are not.

Why seek inner vision or mirror the form,
Or listen for numinous echoes, gaze into limpid pools?
Swallowing mist, drinking dew, ingesting primordial qi,
Their efforts prove futile, hearts and spirits weary.
Expounding on emptiness, tinkering with furnace fires,
Demanding written pledges, collecting gold and treasures.
Daring to equate frogwort with the vast ocean,
Claiming the Primordial Heavenly Worthy is none other than themselves.
Falsely assuming titles, feigning divine powers,
Pointing at ghosts and spirits to expound cause and effect.
Today and tomorrow, they file petitions,
Inner elixir, outer elixir—nothing is beyond them.
Deceiving the worthy, deluding the sages, obscuring the Three Luminaries,
They claim to see fortune and misfortune as clearly as a loom’s shuttle,
Summoning disciples to wander the market’s dust,
Drunk on wine, sated with virtue, forming gangs.

The Great Dao has always transcended names and forms,
True immortals are never adorned with flowers and grasses.
They teach others to take vows and labor diligently—
How is that better than your own diligent practice?
If one person is deluded, it may still be endured,
But delusion passed to delusion leads to old age in confusion.
These blind leading the blind,
Together they enter the maze—truly lamentable.
When fortune is exhausted and retribution arrives,
Offending heaven, there is no place for prayer.
The Three Origins and Nine Palaces record their transgressions,
Their hun and po seized, they endure the underworld’s trials.

The world delights in learning immortality,
Yet how many daily seek the profound mystery?
Each boasts of their own absurdities, competing in loftiness,
Neglecting the true and real as the ultimate truth.

chunks.original_text: 古人好语须切记，工夫纯熟语通仙， 言语不通非眷属，工夫不到不方圆。 我昔工夫行一年，六脉已息气归根， 有一婴儿在丹田，与我形貌亦如然。 翻思尘尘学道者，三年九载空迁延， 依前云水游四海，冷眼看有谁堪传。 灶香问道仍下风，勘辩邪正知愚贤， 归来作此翠虚吟，犹如杲日丽青天，扫除末学小伎术，分别火候炼药物， 只取一味水中金，收拾虚无造化窟，促将百脉尽归源，脉任气停丹始结。 初时枯木依寒岩，二兽相逢如电掣，中央正位产玄珠，浪静风平云雨歇， 半时之间见丹头，软似绵团硬似铁。 此时南方赤凤血，采之须要知时节， 一般才得万般全，复命归根真孔穴。 内中自有真壶天，风物光明月皎洁， 龙吟虎啸铅汞交，灼见黄芽芽白雪，每常天地交合时，夺取阴阳造化机。 卯酉甲庚须沐浴，弦望晦朔要防危，随日随时则斤两，抽添运用在怡怡。 十二时中只一时，九还七返这些儿，温养功须常固济，巽风常向坎中吹。 行坐寝食总如之，性恐火冷丹力迟，一年周天除卯酉，九转工夫月用九， 至於十月玉霜飞，圣胎圆就风雷吼。 一载胎生一个儿，子生孙了又孙枝， 千百亿化最妙处，岂可容易教人知。 忘形死心绝尔汝，存亡动静分宾主， 朝昏药物有浮沉，水火爻符宜检举。 真气熏蒸无寒暑，纯阳流溢无生死。 有一子母分胎路，妙在尾箕斗牛女，若欲延年救老残，断除淫欲行旁门， 果将流形永住世，除非运火炼神丹。 神丹之功三百日，七解七蜕成大还， 聚则成形散成气，天上人间总一般。 宁可求师安乐法，不可邪淫采精血， 古云天地悉皆归，须学无为清净诀。 缚住青山万顷云，捞取碧潭一轮月， 玄关一窍无人知，此是刀圭甚奇绝。 夜来撞见吕秀才，有一丹诀犹奇哉， 却把太虚为炉鼎，活捉乌兔为药材，山河大地发猛火，於中万象生云雷， 昔时混沌今品物，一时交结成圣胎，也无金木相间隔，也无龙虎分南北， 不问子母及雌雄，不问夫妻及黑白，何人名曰大还丹，太上老君吞不得。 老君留与清闲客，服了飞仙登太极，更将一盏鸿蒙酒，饵此刀圭壮颜色， 任从沧海变桑田，我道壶中未一年。 悬知汝心如铁坚，所以口口密相传， 妙处都无半句子，神仙法度真自然。 速须下手结胎仙，朗吟归去蓬莱天。 丹基归一论 古人有言：得其一，万事毕。 噫！ 诚哉！
chunks.translated_text:
The ancients’ wise words must be firmly remembered:
With skill refined and effort pure, speech communes with immortals.
Words that fail to connect reveal no true kinship,
And without sufficient work, nothing attains perfection.

In my own practice, after one year’s cultivation,
The six pulses stilled, and qi returned to its root.
A spiritual infant then dwelt in the cinnabar field,
Its form and visage mirroring my own.

Yet reflecting on those who study the Dao in this dusty world,
After three or nine years, they merely drift in vain.
Still wandering as cloud and water across the four seas,
Cold-eyed, I see who among them is truly worthy of transmission.

Seeking the Dao through incense at the stove, they remain in the lower ranks;
Examining right and wrong, one discerns the foolish from the wise.
Returning, I compose this *Song of Emerald Void*,
Radiant as the sun shining in the azure sky.
It sweeps away the petty arts of lesser learning,
Distinguishing the firing times and refining the elixir’s ingredients.
I take only the gold within water,
Gathering emptiness to forge the crucible of creation.
Urging the hundred pulses to return to their source,
When pulse and conception vessels halt, the elixir begins to coalesce.

At first, a withered tree clings to a cold cliff;
Two beasts meet like lightning in a flash.
From the central, true position, the mysterious pearl is born.
Waves calm, winds cease, clouds and rain disperse.
In half a moment, the elixir’s head appears—
Soft as a cotton ball, hard as iron.

At this time, the crimson phoenix of the south bleeds;
Its gathering requires precise timing.
Once obtained, all things become complete,
Returning to life and rooting in the true cavity.
Within lies a true paradise,
Where landscapes gleam and the moon shines bright.
Dragon chants, tiger roars, lead and mercury unite;
The golden sprout and white snow are clearly seen.
Whenever heaven and earth conjoin,
Seize the mechanism of yin and yang’s creation.

At *mao* and *you*, *jia* and *geng*, one must bathe;
At crescent, full, waning, and new moons, guard against danger.
Adjust the weight daily and hourly,
Withdrawing and adding as needed, all in tranquil harmony.
Within the twelve hours, only one moment matters—
Nine returns, seven reversions, these are the steps.
The work of warming and nurturing must be steadfast,
The *xun* wind ever blowing into the *kan* trigram.
In walking, sitting, sleeping, and eating, remain thus,
Lest the fire cool and the elixir’s power lag.
After a year, the celestial cycle excludes *mao* and *you*;
Nine revolutions of effort consume nine months.
By the tenth month, jade frost descends,
The sacred embryo perfects, and wind and thunder roar.

A year’s gestation births one child,
Who begets grandchildren, branching endlessly.
In this most wondrous transformation of thousands and millions,
How could it be lightly taught to others?

Forget form, still the heart, sever all "you" and "I";
In life and death, movement and stillness, distinguish host from guest.
Morning and evening, the elixir’s ingredients rise and sink;
Water and fire, hexagrams and talismans must be carefully managed.
True qi steams without cold or heat,
Pure yang flows without birth or death.

There is a path where mother and child part ways—
Its wonder lies in the Dipper’s tail and the Oxherd and Weaver maidens.
If you wish to prolong life and rescue the aged and infirm,
Cut off lust and abandon the side gates.
To permanently preserve this flowing form in the world,
You must circulate the fire and refine the spirit elixir.

The spirit elixir’s work takes three hundred days;
Seven dissolutions, seven moltings complete the great return.
Gathered, it forms a body; scattered, it becomes qi—
The same in heaven as it is among men.

Better to seek a master’s peaceful method
Than to perversely plunder essence and blood.
As the ancients said, "All under heaven returns to this"—
You must learn the non-action of the pure and still.

Bind the ten thousand acres of clouds to the green mountain,
Scoop the full moon from the azure pool.
The mysterious pass—a single aperture—none know it,
Yet this is the most wondrous *daogui* knife.

One night, I encountered Master Lü the Scholar,
Who possessed an elixir formula even more marvelous:
He took the great void as his crucible,
Seized the sun and moon as his ingredients.
Mountains, rivers, and the vast earth ignited with fierce fire,
Within which the ten thousand images birthed clouds and thunder.
The primordial chaos of old became the myriad things,
All conjoining in an instant to form the sacred embryo.
No gold or wood intervened,
No dragon or tiger divided south and north.
No inquiry into mother or child, female or male,
No distinction between husband and wife, black or white.
What man calls the Great Return Elixir?
Even the Supreme Lord Lao could not swallow it.

The Old Lord left it for the carefree wanderer,
Who, upon consuming it, ascends as an immortal to the Great Ultimate.
With a cup of primordial wine,
Feeding on this *daogui* to strengthen the countenance—
Though the seas may turn to mulberry fields,
In my Dao, a year in the pot has not yet passed.

I know your heart is firm as iron,
Thus I transmit these words secretly, mouth to mouth.
In the wondrous place, not half a phrase exists—
The immortal’s method is truly natural.

Hasten to begin, knit the embryo immortal,
And chant brightly as you return to Penglai’s heaven.

**On the Foundation of the Elixir Returning to the One**

The ancients said: "Attain the One, and all things are complete."
Ah!
How true!

chunks.original_text: 是言也。 此吾所以刻丹经之繁芜，标紫书之枢要，盖为是也。 一也者，金丹之基也，实千经万论之原，千变万化之祖也。 以要言之，天魂地魄，即日精月华也； 红铅黑汞，即金精木液也； 乌兔即龟蛇也，马牛即龙虎也，朱砂水银，乃黄芽白雪之骨也，丹砂秋石，乃白金黑锡之由也。 别之为男女夫妇，体之为金木水火，类之为青幽徐扬，象之为乾坤坎高。 或日河车者，或黄举者，或有言交梨火枣者，或有言金砂玉汞者。 又如丁翁黄婆之名，婴儿姹女之号，拆为黑白，分为青黄，有如许之纷纷，其实阴阳二字也，是皆一物，谓如守一坛，戊己户，玄关一窍，玄牝之门，神水华池，铅炉土釜，朱砂鼎，偃月炉，中黄宫，丹元府，神室气府，关元丹田，呼吸之根，凝结之所，此又皆一处也。 复如冬夏二至，春秋两分，卯酉甲庚，弦望晦朔，子午巳亥，寅子坤申，二十四炁，七十二候，一年交合，一月周回，高坎之时，兔鸡之月，乾巽之穴，二八之门，朝屯暮蒙，昼姤夜复。 人不知以为果须依时按节，推气测候，分拆数法，准则铢爻，故曰视土圭，夜瞻刻漏，谬之甚矣！ 又岂知周年造化，乃周身之精气，日夜时刻，乃精气之变态也。 其中有衰有旺，有升降，有浮沉，有清有浊。 是以圣人以外象证之，殊不知天地气数，在乎一时之工．夫也。 所以中间有阴阳寒暑之证，有生杀盈亏之状，小则按百刻，大则如一年，只在一时而然也。 然一时即一处也，一处即一物也，人知此之所以为一，则采取有法，运用有度，斤两有则，水火有等，与夫抽添进退之妙，沐浴交结之奥，不无防危虑险也。 若毫厘之失，则日月失道，金汞异炉，非知造化之深者，莫克知阴阳之义如是其秘也。 一阴一阳之谓道，道即金丹也，金丹即是也。 古仙上灵，韶人炼七返九还，金液大丹者，故乃入道之捷径耳。 故有片饷工夫，自然交媾，回风混合，百日工灵之语。 行之九月，谓之九转，炼之一年，谓之圣胎。 此其所以隐而不露者，以上天秘惜，不欲轻泄此道耳。 岂得无祸福於传授贤否之间乎！ 即以唾涕精津气血液为阴物也，又以泥丸丹田，心肾脾肺，尾闻夹脊口鼻，非真一处也，何从而知金木之所以间隔，水火之所以既未济者？ 能以一之一字订诸群经，参诸往哲，勿以神气为自然归复，勿以禅定为自然交合，审能如是，或恐暗合孙昊，而终非促百脉以归源，穷九关而彻底，三火所聚，八水同归者也。 至於神入气为胎火，炼药成丹，岂容易明？ 有曰神卫气者，有曰神凝则气聚者，有曰神气自然归复者，皓首茫然，反起虚无之叹。 夫岂知丹基之真一为妙哉！ 若将游浮灵，揖华佺於空蒙盲霭之上者，得一可以毕万，故作《丹经归一论》，以付学者白玉蟾。 颖川陈泥丸太乙刀圭之说，传诸后古云。 水调歌头 赠九霞子鞠九思 夺取天机妙，夜半看辰灼，一些珠露，阿谁运到稻花头？ 便向此时采取，宛如碧莲合药，滴破玉池秋，万籁风初起，明月一沙鸥。 紫河车，乘赤凤，入琼楼。 谓之玉汞，与铅与土正相投。 五气三花聚顶，吹着自然真火，炼得似红榴。 十月胎仙出，雷电送金此。 鹊桥仙 赠垫虚子沙道昭 红莲含药，露珠凝碧，飞落华池滴滴。
chunks.translated_text:
This saying—
it is why I carve away the overgrowth of alchemical scriptures,
why I mark the pivotal essentials of the Purple Writ.
For this is the truth:
The One is the foundation of the Golden Elixir,
the origin of a thousand classics and ten thousand treatises,
the ancestor of a thousand transformations and ten thousand changes.

To speak concisely:
Heavenly soul and earthly spirit are but the essence of the sun and the radiance of the moon;
cinnabar lead and black mercury are but the essence of metal and the fluid of wood.
The crow and hare are the tortoise and serpent;
the horse and ox are the dragon and tiger.
Cinnabar and quicksilver form the bones of the yellow sprout and white snow;
cinnabar and autumn stone arise from white gold and black tin.

Distinguished as male and female, husband and wife,
embodied as metal, wood, water, and fire,
categorized as the azure, the dark, the slow, and the swift,
symbolized as Qian and Kun, Kan and Li—
whether called the River Chariot,
or the Yellow Ascension,
or spoken of as the fire-jujube and the exchange-pear,
or as golden sand and jade mercury—
or by names like Elder Ding and Yellow Matron,
or titles such as Infant Boy and Maiden Girl—
dissected into black and white,
divided into azure and yellow,
all this profusion,
in truth, is but the two words: yin and yang.
All are one thing.

Consider the Guarding-the-One Altar,
the Wu-Ji Gate,
the Mysterious Pass’s single aperture,
the Gate of the Mysterious Female,
the Divine Water and Flower Pool,
the lead furnace and earthen crucible,
the cinnabar tripod,
the recumbent moon furnace,
the Central Yellow Palace,
the Elixir Origin Mansion,
the Spirit Chamber and Qi Mansion,
the Pass Origin and Elixir Field,
the root of breath,
the site of coagulation—
these, too, are all one place.

Again, like the winter and summer solstices,
the spring and autumn equinoxes,
the Mao and You, Jia and Geng,
the crescent and full, the dark and new moons,
the Zi and Wu, Si and Hai, Yin and Shen,
the twenty-four qi,
the seventy-two seasonal markers,
the year’s conjunctions,
the month’s revolutions,
the Kan and Li moments,
the months of the hare and rooster,
the Qian and Xun caverns,
the gates of two and eight,
the morning *Tun* and evening *Meng*,
the day *Gou* and night *Fu*—
people, not knowing, believe one must strictly adhere to times and seasons,
calculate qi and measure markers,
dissect methods by the number,
weigh by the scruple and hexagram.
Thus they say: "Gaze at the earth-gnomon, watch the night’s water-clock"—
how grievously mistaken!

Do they not know that the year’s creation is but the essence and qi of the body’s cycle,
that day and night, hours and moments, are but the transformations of essence and qi?
Within them lie decline and flourishing,
rising and falling,
floating and sinking,
clarity and turbidity.
Thus the sages used external symbols to verify them,
unaware that the qi and numbers of heaven and earth lie in a single moment’s work.

Within this are the signs of yin and yang, cold and heat,
the states of generation and destruction, fullness and deficiency.
In the small, it follows the hundred divisions of the day;
in the large, it mirrors a year—
yet all occurs in a single moment.
That moment is one place;
one place is one thing.

If one knows that this is the One,
then gathering follows method,
circulation has measure,
weights and measures have standards,
water and fire have degrees,
and the wonders of withdrawal and addition, advance and retreat,
the mysteries of bathing and conjoining—
none lack caution against danger, vigilance against peril.
For the slightest error,
and the sun and moon lose their way,
gold and mercury part crucibles.
None but those deeply versed in creation’s workings
can fathom the meaning of yin and yang as profoundly secret as this.

"The Way is called the alternation of one yin and one yang"—
the Way is the Golden Elixir,
the Golden Elixir is this.

The ancient immortals and transcendent spirits,
the refined ones who refined the Seven Returns and Nine Cycles,
the Great Elixir of Golden Liquid—
these were but shortcuts to entering the Dao.
Thus there are sayings of a moment’s work naturally conjoining,
the return of wind blending all,
the hundred days’ achievement of efficacy.
Practiced for nine months, it is called the Nine Revolutions;
refined for a year, it is called the Sacred Embryo.

This is why it remains hidden, not revealed—
heaven’s secrets are cherished,
and this Dao is not lightly disclosed.
How could there be no fortune or misfortune in transmitting it to the worthy or unworthy?

Even saliva, nasal mucus, essence, fluids, qi, and blood are yin substances,
while Mud Pill Palace, Elixir Field, heart, kidneys, spleen, lungs,
tailgate, spine, mouth, and nose—
these are not truly one place.
How then can one know the separation of metal and wood,
the incompletion of water and fire?

If one can use the One to rectify the multitude of classics,
to examine the words of past sages,
not taking spirit and qi as naturally returning,
not taking meditation as naturally conjoining—
if one can discern thus,
perhaps one may unknowingly align with Sun and Hao,
yet still not hasten the hundred meridians to return to the source,
exhaust the nine passes to their depths,
where the three fires gather,
the eight waters converge.

As for spirit entering qi to form the fetal fire,
refining the medicine into the elixir—
how can this be easily understood?
Some say "spirit guards qi,"
some say "when spirit congeals, qi gathers,"
some say "spirit and qi naturally return"—
white-haired, they remain bewildered,
sighing in vain at emptiness.
How could they know the true wonder of the Elixir Foundation’s One?

Those who wander in floating spirits,
who bow to Hua Quan in the misty obscurity above—
attaining the One can complete the ten thousand.
Thus I write *On the Foundation of the Elixir Returning to the One*
and entrust it to the scholars, to White Jade Toad.

The teachings of Chen Niyuan of Yingchuan,
the Supreme Unity’s Knife and Round,
are transmitted to later ages.

---

**Water Melody Song**
*For Jiu Xiazi, Ju Jiushi*

Seize the wondrous celestial mechanism,
at midnight watch the stars blaze.
A droplet of pearly dew—
who guides it to the rice flower’s head?
Gather it now, in this moment,
like a green lotus closing its petals to concoct the medicine,
piercing the autumn of the Jade Pool.
As the ten thousand sounds stir the first wind,
a lone gull glides beneath the bright moon.

The Purple River Chariot,
riding the crimson phoenix,
enters the jade tower.
This is called jade mercury,
which, with lead and earth, perfectly aligns.
The five qi and three flowers gather at the crown,
stoked by the true fire of nature,
refined until it resembles the pomegranate’s red.
After ten months, the fetal immortal emerges,
borne away by thunder and lightning.

---

**Magpie Bridge Immortal**
*For Dianxuzi, Sha Daozhao*

The red lotus holds the medicine,
dew pearls congeal in azure,
falling drop by drop into the Flower Pool.

chunks.original_text: 运归金鼎唤丁公，炼得似一枚朱橘。 三花喷火，五云拥月，上有金胎神室。 洞房云雨正春风，十个月胎仙了毕。 真珠帘 赠海南子白玉蟾 金丹大药人人有，要须是心传口授。 一片白龙肝，一盏醍醐酒，只向高无寻坎有，移部南辰回北斗。 好笑，见金翁姹女，两个厮斗。 些儿铅汞调匀，观汉月海潮，抽添火候。 一箭透三关，方表神仙手。 兔子方来乌处住，龟兄便把蛇吞了， 知否； 那两个锺吕，是吾师友。 金丹诗诀 半斤真汞半斤铅，隐在灵源太极先，须趁子时当采取，炼成金液入丹田。 神符白雪结玄珠，此是金丹第一炉，十二时辰须认子，莫教金鼎汞花枯。 水火相交虎遇龙，金翁姥女两争雄，青去白来然后黑，到红方且入黄宫。 玉炉三转见黄芽，火裹红莲解发花，人在绛官贪夜月； 一杯美酒饵丹砂。 四转红炉转四神，添符进火养胎精，龙虎绕炉争造化，巽风吹起水中灯。 五转方成白马芽，却教六贼运河车，五行俱备雷声震。 正好登楼看汞花。 炼成玉液玉神丹，擒制龟蛇顷刻间，已是中成消息处，玉炉养火莫教寒。 天上七星地七宝，人有七#1窍权归脑，七返灵砂阴气消，铅炉只使温温火。 八转神锦玉清砂，卯酉抽添火不差，渴饮华池饥嚼气，黄婆终日看金花。 九转紫金成至宝，天门地户自关琐，三百八十有四铢，散为三万六千颗。 青童把镜照泥丸，五脏祥云彻上关，子午寅申和巳亥，胎圆数足出昆仑。 移将北斗向南辰，穿过黄庭入紫庭，钻簇一年真造化，太阳正照月三更。 上应星辰下应铅，太阳三十六交踱，不因法象无由采，谁语生於天地先。 黄丹胡粉密陀僧，此是嘉州造化能，若不见阳真一法，世间还有几人曾。 红铅之髓名真汞，黑汞之精是正铅，莫向肾中求造化，却须心裹觅先天。 灵汞元非是水银，丹砂不赤太迷人，此般真物谁能识，识者縿鸾脱世尘。 三种真形一种稀，结成灵异少人知，莫言龙虎同源出，便是神仙立兆基。 镇星合得配中央，偃水能交色变黄，不比凡金银与铁，成时全是赖阴阳。 莫近丘坟秽污田，亦嫌战地产人眠，坤来灵气形为福，便是求仙小洞天。 山林静处最宜良，或在尘中或在乡，土德厚时丹得厚，妄为立见有迍殃。 室宜向木对朝阳，兑有明窗对夕光，照顾有名人莫晓，暮阴不得闭金墙。 八门运化应时开，进退随金定往来，莫息明炉并百户，安然二鼎位三台。 六百篇中起伏明，三光须顺日虚盈，推移八卦明斤两，刻漏相参莫住程。 阴火息时阳火销，理分外立顺羲爻，更随黑白天边月，六候方终晦朔交。 四时推运逐星杓，昼夜停分百刻昭，郑重元君重定式，细详时候已明标。 天上分明十二时，人问分作炼丹程，若言刻漏无凭信，不会玄机药未成。 心地虚闲绝万绿，且宜清静返身观，要知铁脊梁之汉，何虑修丹下手难。 言者不知知不言，高谈阔论万千般，虽然眼下无人辩，恐汝终身被自瞒。 人如得道自婴儿，不辩闲言是与非，君若不能心具眼，他时追悔问他谁。 执着之人得不真，朝行幕辍又非诚，诚心修炼见功验，方是人中识得人。 父精母血结胎成，尚自他形似我形，身内认吾真父母，方才捉得五行精。 子时气对尾闲关，夹脊河车透顶门，一颗水晶入炉内，赤龙含汞上泥丸。

**Returning to the Golden Crucible, Calling Ding Gong,**
Refined until it resembles a single crimson tangerine.
The Three Flowers spew flame,
the Five Clouds embrace the moon,
above lies the golden womb’s divine chamber.
The bridal chamber’s clouds and rain stir with spring’s breeze—
after ten months, the fetal immortal is complete.

**True Pearl Curtain**
*For Hainanzi, Bai Yuchan*

The great elixir of golden cinnabar is within every person,
but it must be transmitted heart-to-mind, mouth-to-ear.
A slice of the White Dragon’s liver,
a cup of *tihu* wine—
seek only in the high where none exists, in the low where all abides,
shifting the Southern Aster to turn the Northern Dipper.
How laughable—
the Golden Elder and the Mystic Maiden,
the two locked in struggle.
A touch of lead and mercury blended just so,
observe the Han’s moon and the sea’s tide,
drawing and adding the fire’s measure.
An arrow piercing the Three Passes—
only then does the immortal’s hand reveal itself.
The hare arrives where the crow dwells,
the tortoise brother swallows the serpent whole.
Do you know?
Those two, Zhong and Lü,
are my teachers and friends.

**Verses on the Golden Elixir**

Half a catty of true mercury, half a catty of lead,
hidden in the numinous source before the Supreme Ultimate.
Seize the hour of *zi* to gather it,
refine it into golden liquid to enter the cinnabar field.
Divine talismans, white snow congealing into the mysterious pearl—
this is the golden elixir’s first furnace.
Through the twelve hours, recognize *zi* as the key,
lest the golden crucible’s mercury flowers wither.

Water and fire intertwine, tiger meets dragon,
the Golden Elder and the Mystic Maiden vie for mastery.
Green departs, white arrives, then turns to black—
only at red does it enter the Yellow Palace.
The jade crucible’s third revolution reveals the yellow sprout,
within fire, the red lotus unfurls its petals.
The adept lingers in the Crimson Palace, craving the night’s moon—
a cup of fine wine to nourish the cinnabar.

The fourth revolution of the red furnace turns the Four Spirits,
adding talismans, stoking the fire to nurture the fetal essence.
Dragon and tiger coil around the crucible, contending for creation,
the *xun* wind stirs the lamp upon the water.
The fifth revolution yields the White Horse’s sprout,
then the Six Bandits drive the River Chariot.
The Five Phases complete, thunder’s roar resounds—
now is the time to ascend the tower and gaze upon the mercury flowers.

Refined into jade liquid, the divine cinnabar elixir,
seizing and subduing the tortoise and serpent in an instant.
Here lies the moment of completion’s subtle work—
tend the jade crucible’s fire, let it not grow cold.

Heaven’s seven stars, earth’s seven treasures,
man’s seven apertures governed by the brain.
The sevenfold-returned numinous cinnabar consumes yin’s breath—
in the lead furnace, use only the gentlest fire.

The eighth revolution: divine brocade, Jade Clarity’s sand,
*mao* and *you* draw and add fire without error.
Thirst quenched by the Flower Pool, hunger sated by qi,
the Yellow Matron watches the golden flowers all day.
The ninth revolution: purple gold becomes the supreme treasure,
the Gate of Heaven and Door of Earth seal themselves.
Three hundred eighty-four *zhu*,
scattered into thirty-six thousand grains.

The Azure Youth holds the mirror to the Muddy Pellet,
auspicious clouds from the five viscera pierce the upper pass.
*Zi*, *wu*, *yin*, *shen*, *si*, and *hai*—
when the fetal orb’s count is full, it emerges from Kunlun.

Shift the Northern Dipper toward the Southern Aster,
pierce the Yellow Court to enter the Purple Court.
A year of drilling and clustering brings true creation—
the Great Yang shines directly at the moon’s third watch.

Above, it aligns with the stars; below, with lead.
The Great Yang paces thirty-six exchanges.
Without the dharma’s image, how could it be gathered?
Who speaks of birth before heaven and earth?

Yellow cinnabar, ceruse, litharge—
these are Jiazhou’s powers of creation.
If you have not witnessed the true Yang’s singular method,
how many in the world have ever known it?

The essence of red lead is called true mercury,
the essence of black mercury is true lead.
Seek not creation in the kidneys—
look instead within the heart for the primordial.

Numinous mercury is not mere quicksilver,
cinnabar’s lack of redness deludes most.
Who can recognize such true substances?
Those who do mount simurghs to shed the world’s dust.

Three true forms, one rare,
congealing into numinous marvels few understand.
Do not say dragon and tiger share a single source—
this is the immortal’s foundation laid.

The Star of Stability paired with the center,
reclining water’s union changes its hue to yellow.
Unlike common gold, silver, or iron,
its completion relies wholly on yin and yang.

Avoid graves, defiled fields,
and battle-scarred lands where men sleep.
When *kun*’s numinous qi takes form as fortune,
it becomes the seeker’s minor grotto-heaven.

Mountain forests’ quietude is most fitting,
whether in the world’s dust or the countryside.
When earth’s virtue is thick, the elixir grows thick—
reckless acts swiftly bring misfortune.

The chamber should face wood, toward the rising sun,
*dui*’s bright window facing the evening light.
Guard it well—let no one know its name,
and at dusk’s yin, do not seal the golden walls.

The Eight Gates’ transformations open in due time,
advancing and retreating with the metal’s decree.
Do not neglect the bright furnace or the hundred doors—
calmly, the two crucibles occupy the Three Terraces.

The six hundred verses rise and fall with clarity,
the Three Luminaries must follow the sun’s emptiness and fullness.
Shift the Eight Trigrams to clarify weight and measure,
align with the clepsydra’s flow—do not halt the process.

When yin’s fire ceases, yang’s fire dissolves,
principles divide externally, following Fu Xi’s lines.
Follow further the black and white of heaven’s edge-moon—
only after the six periods does the new moon meet the dark.

The four seasons’ revolutions follow the star-ladle,
day and night evenly divided into a hundred marks.
Reverently, the Primordial Sovereign reaffirms the pattern—
scrutinize the times, for they are clearly marked.

Heaven’s twelve hours are distinct,
yet mortals divide them into the elixir’s regimen.
If you claim the clepsydra lacks proof,
you will not grasp the mystery, and the medicine will not form.

The heart-earth empty and idle, severed from ten thousand threads,
best to return to stillness and observe the self.
To know the iron-spined man—
what worry is there in beginning the elixir’s work?

Those who speak do not know; those who know do not speak.
Lofty discourse and grand theories abound,
yet though none may argue now,
you may deceive yourself for a lifetime.

One who attains the Dao becomes like an infant,
unmoved by idle words, right or wrong.
If you cannot see with the heart’s eye,
who will you ask in regret later?

The obstinate cannot grasp the truth,
morning’s practice abandoned by dusk—this is not sincerity.
Only with a sincere heart and diligent refinement will results appear—
then you are among those who truly know.

Father’s essence, mother’s blood congeal to form the fetus,
yet its shape still resembles another’s.
Recognize the true father and mother within the body—
only then can you seize the Five Phases’ essence.

At the hour of *zi*, qi faces the *weilü* pass,
the spinal River Chariot pierces the crown’s gate.
A crystal pearl enters the crucible—
the Red Dragon holds mercury, ascending to the Muddy Pellet.

chunks.original_text: 气入丹田养白鸦，斯时方日结黄芽，华池神水含明月，取得刀圭大似麻。 须知药得火成丹，又要丹逢火则仙，片饷工夫修便现，老成须是过三年。 大道分明在眼前，时人不会悮归泉，黄芽本是乾坤气，神水根基与汞连。 认得根源不用忙，三三合九有纯阳，潜通变化神光现，从此朝天近玉皇。 合其天地合其元，子母相逢不敢言，先汞后铅为大道，莫教失伴鹤归天。 此宝从来二八传，吉年吉月入炉安，十朝火候知时节，必定芽成汞自完。 志默忘言理最端，更无一物可相关，回眸馒着些儿力，一得分明万事闲。 红铅黑汞大丹基，红黑相投世罕知，两物若还成戊己，仙家故日一刀圭。 日乌月兔两轮圆，根在先天核取难，月夜望中能采取，天魂地魄结灵丹。 莫谓金丹事等闲，切须勤苦力钻研，殷勤好问师资学，不在他边在目前。 未炼还丹先养铅，龟蛇一气产先天，虚心实腹方和合，结就灵砂一粒圆。 同行同坐又同眠，终日相随在目前，认得这些须急采，见之便是水乡铅。 不是灯光日月星，药灵自有异常明，垂帘久视光明处，一颗堂堂现本真。 终日如愚岂有无，馒将闲裹着工夫，初时玉液飞空雪，渐见流金满故庐。 灵汞通真变化多，只宜存守不宜过，神符默运三关彻，铅趁黄河入大罗。 甲龙庚虎镇相随，铅汞同炉始可为，曾取地天交泰事，自然交媾坎和高。 周天火候至幽显，运动抽添尽有时，气候何须分八节，只防片饷失毫厘。 五行四象坎并高，诗诀分明说与伊，只有工夫下手处，几人会得几人知。 若未逢师且看诗，诗中藏诀好修持，虽然不到蓬莱路，也得人闲死较迟。 昼运灵旗夜火芝，抽添运用且防危，若无同志相亲赏，时照炉中火候非。 震卦行归西兑乡，三阳姹女弄明铛，巽风吹动珊瑚树，入艮归坤又一场。 握拳闭目守流珠，这个元来是入途，不见《悟真篇》内说，真金起屋几时枯。 谁知前短后长机，十二时中只一时，晦朔望弦明进退，炼成九转结婴儿。 昆仑山上火星飞，金木相逢坎电时，药到月圆须满秤，急教进火莫蹉迟。 大药须凭神气精，采来一处结交成，丹头只是先天气，炼作黄芽发玉英。 分明只在片言问，老去殊途有易难，先自刀圭言下悟，渐收九转大还丹。 两处擒来共一炉，一泓真水结真酥，刀圭滋味吞归腹，浇灌黄芽产玉符。 捉将百脉倒归源，自会天然汞见铅，大地山河皆至宝，谁知身裹觅先天。 宫中眼底火星飞，雷电掀翻白雪垂，身裹漏声闻滴滴，三尸精血可充饥。 五行四象外边寻，只在当人一寸心，运用阴阳成妙道，直教瓦砾尽成金。 偃月炉中缎坎高，片时自有一刀圭，寄言师祖张平叔，万圣千贤总在西。 醉倒酣眠梦熟时，满船载宝过曹溪，一才识破丹基处，放去收来绝在伊。 西南路上月华明，大药还从此处生，记得古人诗一句，曲江之上鹊桥横。 一月三旬一日同，修丹法象夺天功，交加二八为丹母，望远徒劳觅虎龙。 尾闾白黑贯丹田，一颗真珠软似绵，满地冷光生玉笑，两池秋水漾红莲。 鼎炉火候密推排，炼得纯阳气上来，地户闭时骨体实，天门积渐自然开。 水为灵符冲和液，火是丹枢混沌精，会在宫中凝结处，自然结药复生英。 男儿怀孕是胎仙，只为蟾光夜夜圆，夺得天机真造化，身中自有玉清天。

Qi enters the cinnabar field to nourish the white crow—
only then does the day yield the yellow sprout.
The Flower Pool’s divine water cradles the bright moon,
and the *daogui* obtained is as small as a sesame seed.

Know that medicine, refined by fire, becomes the elixir,
and the elixir, meeting fire, becomes immortal.
A moment’s effort yields immediate results,
yet mastery demands three years of ripening.

The Great Dao lies plain before your eyes,
yet people fail to grasp it and waste their return to the spring.
The yellow sprout is none other than the qi of heaven and earth,
while the divine water’s root is linked to mercury.

Once you recognize the source, there is no need to rush—
three threes unite as nine, forming pure yang.
Hidden transformations manifest as divine radiance,
and from here, you ascend near the Jade Emperor.

Unite heaven and earth, merge their primal essence,
mother and child meet in silent reverence.
First mercury, then lead—this is the Great Dao;
do not let the companionless crane return to heaven.

This treasure has long been passed down through the two eights,
in an auspicious year and month, it is placed in the furnace.
Ten days of fire-tending, knowing the seasons,
surely the sprout matures and mercury is perfected.

Silent intent, wordless principle—this is the truest path,
nothing else binds or relates.
Turn your gaze inward with but a trace of effort,
and once clarity dawns, all affairs grow still.

Red lead and black mercury form the foundation of the great elixir,
their union is rarely known in the world.
When these two become *wu* and *ji*,
the immortals call it a single *daogui*.

The sun’s crow and moon’s hare, two wheels full,
their root lies in precelestial essence—hard to grasp.
On a moonlit night, if you can gather them,
heaven’s soul and earth’s spirit congeal into the numinous elixir.

Do not dismiss the golden elixir as trivial—
you must labor diligently and delve deeply.
Seek guidance from teachers and mentors,
for it lies not elsewhere, but right before you.

Before refining the returning elixir, first cultivate lead;
the tortoise and snake, one qi, give birth to the precelestial.
Empty the heart, fill the belly—only then can harmony arise,
forging the numinous cinnabar into a single, perfect sphere.

Walking together, sitting together, sleeping side by side,
they follow you all day, ever present.
Recognize these swiftly and gather them in haste—
to see them is to find the lead of the watery realm.

Not lamp-light, sun, moon, nor stars,
the medicine’s spirit shines with extraordinary brightness.
With eyes half-closed, gaze long into the luminous place—
a resplendent pearl reveals its true nature.

To spend the day in seeming foolishness—what is there to gain or lose?
Stealthily apply effort amid idleness.
At first, jade liquid flies like drifting snow,
gradually, flowing gold fills the old hut.

Numinous mercury, attuned to the true, transforms endlessly—
it is best to preserve and guard, not to overstep.
The divine talisman silently courses through the three passes,
while lead follows the Yellow River into the Great Luo.

The *jia*-dragon and *geng*-tiger stand guard together,
only when lead and mercury share the furnace can work begin.
Recall the union of earth and heaven in harmonious balance—
naturally, *kan* and *li* unite in marriage.

The fire-tending of the celestial cycle spans the hidden and manifest,
its movements of withdrawal and addition occur in due time.
Why divide the qi-seasons into eight nodes?
Beware even a moment’s lapse or a hair’s breadth of error.

The Five Phases, Four Images, *kan* and *li*—
the poetic verses clearly explain them to you.
Yet where the work truly begins,
how many comprehend? How many know?

If you have not yet met a teacher, study these verses,
for within them lies the secret to cultivation.
Though you may not reach Penglai’s path,
you will at least gain leisure in life and delay death.

By day, circulate the numinous banner; by night, tend the fiery mushroom.
Withdraw and add with care, ever vigilant against danger.
Without like-minded companions to share and appreciate,
how can you gauge the furnace’s fire-tending?

The *zhen* trigram returns to the *dui* region in the west,
the three yangs and the maiden play with the bright cauldron.
The *xun* wind stirs the coral tree,
entering *gen* and returning to *kun*—another cycle begins.

Clench your fists, close your eyes, guard the flowing pearl—
this is the true path of entry.
As the *Wuzhen Pian* states:
when true gold builds the house, how can it ever wither?

Who knows the mechanism of short before and long after?
Within the twelve hours, only one moment matters.
Waxing and waning, full and new—advance and retreat,
refining through nine cycles to gestate the infant.

On Kunlun’s peak, fire stars fly,
when metal and wood meet at the *kan*-thunder hour.
When the medicine reaches the full moon, the scale must be full—
hurry to add fire, lest you miss the moment.

The great medicine relies on spirit, qi, and essence;
gathered in one place, they unite and form.
The elixir’s head is but precelestial qi,
refined into the yellow sprout, blooming as jade blossoms.

The truth lies plain in a single word,
yet in old age, the paths diverge in ease and difficulty.
First, awaken to the *daogui* in an instant,
then gradually refine the nine cycles of the great returning elixir.

Seize the two and place them in one furnace,
a pool of true water congeals into true butter.
Swallow the *daogui*’s savor, let it return to your belly,
nourishing the yellow sprout to yield the jade talisman.

Draw back the hundred vessels, return them to the source—
naturally, mercury will meet lead.
The mountains and rivers of the great earth are all treasures,
yet who knows to seek the precelestial within the body?

Within the palace, beneath the eyes, fire stars fly,
thunder and lightning churn, white snow hangs suspended.
Within the body, the sound of dripping is heard—
the three corpses’ essence and blood can sate hunger.

Seek the Five Phases and Four Images outside,
yet they reside within a single inch of your heart.
Master the interplay of yin and yang to perfect the wondrous Dao,
and even tiles and pebbles will turn to gold.

In the crescent-moon furnace, refine *kan* and *li*—
in a moment, a single *daogui* forms.
A message to the patriarch Zhang Ping Shu:
the ten thousand sages and thousand worthies all reside in the west.

When drunk and deeply asleep in dream,
a boat laden with treasure crosses Cao Creek.
Once you discern the foundation of the elixir,
its release and gathering lie entirely in your hands.

On the southwestern road, the moon’s radiance shines bright—
the great medicine arises from this place.
Recall an ancient verse:
above the winding river, the magpie bridge spans.

A month’s thirty days, a single day—
the method of elixir-refining rivals heaven’s work.
The union of two eights becomes the mother of the elixir,
while seeking dragons and tigers afar is but vain labor.

White and black thread the *weilü* to the cinnabar field,
a single true pearl, soft as silk.
Cold light fills the earth, birthing jade’s laughter,
while the two pools’ autumn waters ripple with red lotuses.

The crucible’s fire-tending is meticulously arranged,
refining until pure yang qi ascends.
When the earthly gate closes, the bones and body solidify;
gradually, the heavenly gate opens of its own accord.

Water is the numinous talisman, the harmonious fluid,
fire is the elixir’s pivot, the primordial essence.
When they meet in the palace’s congealing point,
the medicine naturally forms, and new life blooms.

A man’s pregnancy births the fetal immortal—
all because the toad’s light waxes full each night.
Seizing heaven’s mechanism, the true transformation,
within the body, the Jade Pure Heaven resides.

chunks.original_text: 鼎中朱橘亘天红，此是时时养火功，元炁归炉神不散，春山春水自春风。 金鼎先乾活水银，水银乾了大丹成，分明有个长生草，点铁成金不悮人。 涕唾精津气血液，真伪混淆须辩惑，从无生有是药材，不可滞他虚幻物。 经文变化在须臾，迷者何求日月疏，但守火爻三百刻，产成一颗夜明珠。 天源一派接昆仑，最隐无过九曲湾，百万玉龙嘶未断，一江春月趁渔船。 精神冥合黑归时，骨肉融和都不知，关节自开通畅也，形容光泽似婴儿。 分两须当应两弦，此般法象合天渊，回头问取黄婆看，何必区区待口传。 铅汞之宗龙虎根，玄牝之户戊己门，只向玉壶春色裹，摘枝花去问羲轩。 近则三朝远九旬，须知变化有时辰，不知造化长生药，濑汞成金也动人。 鼎鼎元无药裹寻，寻来出去一般金，铸成大小多随意，便是冰壶妙理深。 入鼎须凭重一斤，秤来却是十六星，一星水裹真金妙，合作流珠二八停。 坎府均塘石脚泉，星斗相对射高天，潺湲阳脉通青白，沐浴要教金体坚。 尽道真人总默然，如何也不示言诠，若不骄傲事无语，只是胸中欠汞铅。 天地初分日月高，状如鸡子复如桃，阴阳真气知时节，直待三年脱战袍。 龙虎丹砂义最幽，五神金内汞铅流，千朝变紫飞云去，直至大罗天上头。 用铅须得汞相和，二姓为亲女唱歌，炼到紫河车地动，白云相伴鹤来过。 红黑相将妇嫁夫，一年一度入丹枢，洞房深处真云雨，产个婴儿一似渠。 坎男高女住乾天，买药烧丹不用钱，偃月炉中烹造化，一些妙药要真铅。 怪事教人笑几回？ 男儿今也会怀胎，自家精血自交结，身裹夫妻是妙哉。 三姓包含二物交，赤龙飞上碧云霄，夜来甘露空中过，片月横空对鹊桥。 复姤修持水火宗，兔鹦沐浴内丹红，周天六六寒炉后，十月胎圆显圣功。 水火同精间木金，火木知他甚处寻，脱黄着紫因何事，只为河车数转深。 玉符金液炼天仙，月照昆仑一沼莲，试指北方玄武事，龟蛇因甚两相缠。 雨洗新篁双凤飞，玉芝花下一灵龟，抱琴弹尽舞仙曲，却放姐娥宴小池。 透体金光骨髓香，金筋玉骨尽纯阳，炼教赤白流为白，阴气消磨身自康。 一旦工夫尽志诚，凝神聚气固真精，颜容如玉无饥渴，方显金丹片饷成。 翠娥独立水晶宫，体态娇烧有意浓，半夜黄婆来叩户，作媒嫁去与金翁。 太乙玄珠金液丹，还元返本驻童颜，要须亲听明师语，方可教君见一班。 夜来一朵碧芙叶，内有红丸滴滴珠，滴下华池是神水，丹田结聚作丹枢。 高坎名为水火精，本是乾坤二卦成，但取坎精点高穴，纯乾便可摄飞琼。 翠虚篇竟 #1 此处原脱三字。
chunks.translated_text:
Within the crucible, vermilion tangerines glow crimson across the sky—
this is the ceaseless work of nurturing the fire.
Primal qi returns to the furnace, the spirit unscattered,
as spring mountains, spring waters, and spring winds arise of themselves.

First dry the golden crucible to quicken living mercury,
when the mercury is dried, the great elixir is complete.
Clearly there grows an herb of immortality,
transmuting iron to gold without deceiving man.

Tears, saliva, essence, fluids, qi, and blood—
true and false intermingle, requiring discernment.
From nothing comes something: these are the medicinal materials,
not to be confused with illusory, hollow things.

Scriptural transformations occur in an instant,
yet the deluded seek them in distant days and months.
Simply guard the fire-hexagram for three hundred moments,
and a luminous pearl is born in the night.

A celestial source flows straight from Kunlun,
nowhere more hidden than the Nine-Bend Bay.
A million jade dragons roar without cease,
as a river of spring moonlight chases the fishing boats.

When spirit and essence merge in the return to darkness,
bone and flesh fuse so subtly they go unnoticed.
The joints open and flow freely,
the countenance gleams, smooth as an infant’s.

Measurements must correspond to the two crescents,
this pattern of the law mirrors heaven’s abyss.
Turn and ask the Yellow Dame for guidance—
why wait for mere oral transmission?

Lead and mercury trace back to the roots of dragon and tiger,
the Mysterious Female’s gate is the door of wu and ji.
Only within the jade pot of spring’s hues
may one pluck a blossom to question Fu Xi and Xuan Yuan.

Near, it takes three mornings; far, ninety days—
know that transformations have their appointed hours.
Without understanding the elixir of long life’s creation,
even lazy mercury transmuting to gold stirs wonder.

The crucible holds no hidden medicine to seek,
what is sought and what emerges are the same gold.
Cast it large or small at will—
such is the profound principle of the ice-pure vessel.

Entering the crucible requires a weight of one jin,
yet when weighed, it becomes sixteen stars.
Each star holds true gold’s wonder within water,
combining to form flowing pearls in perfect balance.

The Kan Palace’s even pond, the stone-foot spring,
stars face one another, shooting toward the high heavens.
The murmuring yang pulse courses through green and white,
bathing the golden body to make it firm.

All say the Perfected One remains utterly silent—
how could he ever reveal it through words?
If not for arrogance, matters would require no speech,
it is only that the chest lacks mercury and lead.

When heaven and earth first parted, sun and moon rose high,
shaped like an egg, then like a peach.
Yin and yang’s true qi knows its seasons,
waiting three years to shed the armor of strife.

The dragon-tiger cinnabar’s meaning is most profound,
within the five-spirit gold, mercury and lead flow.
After a thousand mornings, it turns purple and soars into the clouds,
ascending straight to the Great Canopy Heaven.

To use lead, one must blend it with mercury,
the two families become kin as the woman sings.
When refined to the point the Purple River Chariot stirs the earth,
white clouds accompany the passing crane.

Red and black unite as wife weds husband,
once a year entering the elixir’s pivot.
In the bridal chamber’s depths, true cloud and rain—
a child is born, just like them.

The Kan man and Qian woman dwell in heaven’s domain,
buying medicine and firing the elixir costs no coin.
Within the crescent moon furnace, the work of creation is brewed—
a bit of wondrous medicine requires true lead.

What strange thing provokes laughter time and again?
Now even men can conceive.
Their own essence and blood intermingle,
within the body, husband and wife are wondrous indeed.

Three families contain the union of two things,
the red dragon flies up to the azure clouds.
At night, sweet dew passes through the empty sky,
a sliver of moon hangs above the Magpie Bridge.

Returning to the union, cultivate the water-fire school,
the rabbit and crow bathe in the inner elixir’s red glow.
After sixty-six circuits of the celestial orbit and the cold furnace,
the ten-month fetus matures, revealing sacred power.

Water and fire share essence between wood and metal,
but where does one seek fire and wood?
Shedding yellow to don purple—why?
Only because the River Chariot’s revolutions run deep.

The jade talisman and golden liquid refine the celestial immortal,
moonlight illuminates Kunlun’s lotus pool.
Pointing to the northern Dark Warrior’s affair—
why do tortoise and snake entwine?

Rain washes the new bamboo as twin phoenixes take flight,
beneath the jade mushroom, a sacred tortoise.
Holding the zither, it plays the dance of immortal melodies,
then releases Chang’e to feast by the small pool.

Golden light suffuses the body, the marrow fragrant,
golden sinews and jade bones are wholly yang.
Refined until red and white flow as white,
yin qi dissolves, and the body is naturally sound.

Once the work is done with utmost sincerity,
concentrate the spirit, gather the qi, and secure true essence.
The complexion becomes jade-like, hunger and thirst vanish—
only then does the golden elixir’s momentary formation appear.

The Green Maiden stands alone in the crystal palace,
her graceful form brimming with intent.
At midnight, the Yellow Dame comes knocking at the door,
to act as matchmaker, marrying her to the Golden Elder.

The Great One’s mysterious pearl, the golden liquid elixir,
returns to the origin, restores the root, and preserves youthful countenance.
One must personally heed the enlightened master’s words,
only then may you be shown the way.

At night, a single emerald lotus leaf appears,
within it, red pellets drip like pearls.
Dripping into the Flowery Pond, it becomes spirit water,
congealing in the cinnabar field to form the elixir’s pivot.

High and Kan are called the essences of water and fire,
originally formed from Qian and Kun’s two trigrams.
Simply take Kan’s essence to infuse the high cavity—
pure Qian can then grasp the flying jasper.
